docs.lead_paragraph: Aides in former President Bill Clinton's White House crafted a strategy to "humanize" then-first lady Hillary Clinton and work around her "aversion" to the national media, according to documents released on Friday.

headline.main: Documents Show 1990s Effort to 'Humanize' Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Documents Show 1990s Effort to 'Humanize' Hillary Clinton

docs.snippet: Aides in former President Bill Clinton's White House crafted a strategy to "humanize" then-first lady Hillary Clinton and work around her "aversion" to the national media, according to documents released on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Feb. 28 about health care, The Associated Press incorrectly identified Rep. Cathy McMorris Rodgers as vice chairman of the Republican Conference. She is the chairman of the conference.
docs.snippet: In a story Feb. 28 about health care, The Associated Press incorrectly identified Rep. Cathy McMorris Rodgers as vice chairman of the Republican Conference. She is the chairman of the conference.

docs.lead_paragraph: Diners at a Florida restaurant chain are being asked to pay a health insurance surcharge on their meal tabs to cover the cost for business owners of the Obama administration's new healthcare program.

headline.main: Florida Restaurant Chain Adds Obamacare Surcharge to Meal Bills
headline.print_headline: Florida Restaurant Chain Adds Obamacare Surcharge to Meal Bills

docs.snippet: Diners at a Florida restaurant chain are being asked to pay a health insurance surcharge on their meal tabs to cover the cost for business owners of the Obama administration's new healthcare program.

docs.abstract: Key passages and analysis of thousands of pages of internal documents from Bill Clinton’s White House.
docs.snippet: Key passages and analysis of thousands of pages of internal documents from Bill Clinton’s White House.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bill Clinton's aides revealed concern early in his presidency about the health care overhaul effort led by his wife, Hillary Rodham Clinton, and later about what they saw as a need to soften her image, according to documents released Friday. Mrs. Clinton now is a potential 2016 presidential contender

headline.main: '90s Documents Show Clintons' Health Care Concerns

docs.lead_paragraph: States that have experienced technical problems running their own health care enrollment websites are getting some help from the Obama administration.

headline.main: Troubled State-Run Websites Get Health Law Fix
headline.print_headline: Troubled State-Run Websites Get Health Law Fix

docs.snippet: States that have experienced technical problems running their own health care enrollment websites are getting some help from the Obama administration.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's ban on discriminatory health insurance practices against the sick has not stopped insurers from increasing up-front charges for the expensive drugs needed to control chronic illnesses from leukemia to multiple sclerosis.

headline.main: Chronically Ill Facing High Drugs Costs Under U.S. Health Law
headline.print_headline: Chronically Ill Facing High Drugs Costs Under U.S. Health Law

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's ban on discriminatory health insurance practices against the sick has not stopped insurers from increasing up-front charges for the expensive drugs needed to control chronic illnesses from leukemia to multiple sclerosis.

docs.lead_paragraph: A month after Republicans rallied around offering an alternative to President Barack Obama's healthcare law in an election-year move to broaden their appeal to voters, divisions are surfacing over the issue in the U.S. House of Representatives.

headline.main: U.S. House Republican Unity Tested on Obamacare Alternative
headline.print_headline: U.S. House Republican Unity Tested on Obamacare Alternative

docs.snippet: A month after Republicans rallied around offering an alternative to President Barack Obama's healthcare law in an election-year move to broaden their appeal to voters, divisions are surfacing over the issue in the U.S. House of Representatives.

headline.main: How the Medical Establishment Got the Treasury's Keys

docs.abstract: The struggle over American medical costs can be traced in part to the inherently inflationary terms of the deal that created Medicare nearly a half-century ago, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: The struggle over American medical costs can be traced in part to the inherently inflationary terms of the deal that created Medicare nearly a half-century ago, an economist writes.

keywords.value: House Committee on Ways and Means
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Gary Herbert said he wanted to reject a full Medicaid expansion to enroll more people in the government program and instead seek federal dollars to cover the poor in private plans.

headline.main: Utah: Governor Wants Alternative to Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Utah: Governor Wants Alternative to Medicaid

docs.abstract: Utah's Republican Gov Gary Herbert says he wants to reject full Medicaid expansion to enroll more people in the government program and instead seek federal dollars to cover the poor in private plans.
docs.snippet: Gov. Gary Herbert said he wanted to reject a full Medicaid expansion to enroll more people in the government program and instead seek federal dollars to cover the poor in private plans.
